Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified , , base URI, , , and document type values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor supplies all `DocumentType` information required by <xref:System.Xml.XmlValidatingReader>. If this `XmlParserContext` is passed to an <xref:System.Xml.XmlTextReader>, all DTD information is ignored.
If you pass a DTD as the `internalSubset`, the DTD is used for entity resolution, not for document validation.
## Examples The following example uses an `XmlParserContext` to read an XML fragment.
[!code-csharp[Classic WebData XmlParserContext.XmlParserContext1 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/Classic WebData XmlParserContext.XmlParserContext1 Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic WebData XmlParserContext.XmlParserContext1 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/Classic WebData XmlParserContext.XmlParserContext1 Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the base URI.
Docs.value: The base URI to use to resolve the DTD file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A networked XML document is comprised of chunks of data aggregated using various W3C standard inclusion mechanisms and therefore may contain nodes that come from different places. `BaseURI` shows where these nodes originated.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the document type declaration.
Docs.value: The name of the document type declaration.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property, along with <xref:System.Xml.XmlParserContext.PublicId%2A>, <xref:System.Xml.XmlParserContext.SystemId%2A>, and <xref:System.Xml.XmlParserContext.InternalSubset%2A>, provides all the document type declaration information. It is used to find and load the necessary DTD information so that you get all the default attributes and entities defined in the DTD.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the internal DTD subset.
Docs.value: The internal DTD subset. For example, this property returns everything between the square brackets <!DOCTYPE doc [...]>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property, along with <xref:System.Xml.XmlParserContext.DocTypeName%2A>, <xref:System.Xml.XmlParserContext.PublicId%2A>, and <xref:System.Xml.XmlParserContext.SystemId%2A>, provides all the document type declaration information. It is used to find and load the necessary DTD information so that you get all the default attributes and entities defined in the DTD.
The DTD is used for entity resolution, not for document validation.
